# @toolsync/template

![NPM Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@toolsync/template)

Update sections of source files

<!-- #endregion header -->

## Install

Use your favorite package manager to install this package:

```shell
pnpm install @toolsync/template # pnpm (recommended), you can also use npm, yarn, bun, whatever...
```

## Usage

Let's see how it works:

```ts
import { MarkdownTemplate } from '@toolsync/template';

// Load the current README.md as a template
// If it does not exist an empty string is assumed it's content
const readme = await Markdowntemplate.load('README.md');

// Update a section
readme.update({
  section: 'header', // ID of the section to update
  insert: 'top', // Insert the section on top if it does not exist in the file (otherwise throws)
  content: '# Hello!', // The content to insert. In this example, a markdown string is expected.
});

// Save the updated file back to README.md (you can also provide a different path)
await readme.save();
```

This will create/update a markdown file at `./README.md` with the following content:

```md
<!-- #region header -->

# Hello!

<!-- #regionend header -->

Other content...
```

Whenever you run the script again the section will be updated.

> Take a look at the source of this README, it's also updated with `@toolsync/template` :)
